author: costin
msg: Removed defaultContext from ContextManager and all other classes.
We use getContext("") - it is the root context as defined in the spec,
no need to introduce another notion ( defaultContext).

author: costin
msg: Replaced Constants.Context.Default.Name with it's value ( "" ),
removed defaultContext from ContextManager - the code uses
now cm.getContext("").
This is the start of ContextManager cleanup.
( it wasn't easy to follow the defaultContext logic, while the root
context with "" path is part of the spec )
PR:
Obtained from:
Submitted by:
Reviewed by:

author: rubys
msg: allow JSPs to be loaded from WAR files
Submitted by: Bradley Neuberg <bneuberg@randomwalk.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: Change the default "maximum inactive interval" for new sessions from
-1 (unlimited) to 60 seconds.  As a side effect, this makes the last
failing Watchdog test (SessionTimeOutTest) pass, but this is really
bogus -- it just happens to be the value that the test is looking for.
(As such, that particular test does not have a lot of value IMHO.)
Added an XXX note pointing out that, at present, there is no way for
the Context to tell the Manager (via the SessionManager interface) what
the default timeout should be.  This will be fixed once we commit to
the new Manager/Session paradigm.

author: craigmcc
msg: Complete the implementation of IllegalStateException checks for various
method calls of the HttpSession() interface, and implement a dummy
HttpSessionContext object -- the previous application was returning null.
This cleans up seven of the eight Watchdog tests that were failing with
the initial implementation.  The last one will require an extension to
Costin's SessionManager interface, to allow the Context to tell the
SessionManager what the default session timeout (from the deployment
descriptor) should be.
